intro: Atamasco arenicola, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in sandy or well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces seed capsules that disperse its seeds via the wind. Atamasco arenicola is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
